thread.title: India Ink: Newspapers Boom Where the Internet Doesn’t Reach
thread.title_full: India Ink: Newspapers Boom Where the Internet Doesn’t Reach - WSJ

author: Gabriele Parussini
title: India Ink: Newspapers Boom Where the Internet Doesn’t Reach
text:
NEW DELHI—These may be tough days for newspapers in the U.S. But in India, the old-school, ink-stained business is booming as more people from smaller cities join the middle class, boosting circulation and advertising revenue.
Hindi-language daily Amar Ujala just installed new presses at its plant on the outskirts of the Indian capital that will allow it to increase its print run by a third. Since 2011, the paper’s circulation has... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
